children.name: emotion
children.definition: a strong serious feeling such as love, hate, or anger that is often difficult to control:
examples: cảm xúc
▪ She stared at him, overcome by emotion.
Cô ấy xúc động nhìn anh.
▪ Parents feel a mixture of emotions when their first child starts school.
Bố mẹ có nhiều cảm xúc lẫn lộn khi lần đầu đứa con đầu lòng đến trường.
emotionnoun[ C or U ]
a strong feeling such as love or anger, or strong feelings in general
_Like a lot of men, he finds it hard to express his emotions.
_My mother was overcome with emotion and burst into tears.

children.name: passion
children.definition: a strong and deeply felt emotion, especially a strong feeling of sexual love for someone or a strong belief in an idea or principle:
examples: niềm đam mê
▪ He throws himself into his art with a creative passion
Anh ấy đắm mình vào nghệ thuật với một niềm đam mê sáng tạo.
▪ There is a common prejudice in this country that Italians display their passions more readily than the English.
Có một thành kiến chung ở đất nước này đó là người Ý sẵn sàng thể hiện sự đam mê của mình hơn người Anh.
passion for
niềm đam mê với
▪ Despite his passion for Carolyn, Mark never seriously considered leaving his wife for her
Mặc dù rất si mê Carol, nhưng Mark chưa bao giờ thật sự có ý định rời bỏ vợ mình vì cô ta.
with a passion
rất
▪ She hated her ex-husband with a passion.
Cô ấy căm ghét chồng cũ của mình.
passionnoun[ C or U ]
a very powerful feeling, for example of sexualattraction, love, hate, anger or other emotion
_Footballarousesa good deal of passion among its supporters.
_At school, his early interest in music developed into anabidingpassion.
_Politics and philosophy were hislifelongpassions.

children.name: behaving in a way that shows strong feelings
emotional
children.definition: behaving in a way that shows that you have strong feelings about something, for example by crying or shouting:
examples: xúc động
▪ Grandpa gets very emotional when he talks about the war
Ông nội cảm thấy rất xúc động khi kể về chiến tranh..
emotional outbursta sudden powerful expression of strong emotion
cảm xúc tuôn trào
▪ In an emotional outburst, Shahidi told reporters she now had no life worth living.
Trong lúc cảm xúc đang tuôn trào, Shahidi nói với các phóng viên rằng cô ấy đang sống trong vô nghĩa
emotionally[adverb]
một cách xúc động
▪ Imran shook my hand and said emotionally, ‘I’ll miss you, my friend.
Imran bắt tay tôi và xúc động nói, "Mình sẽ rất nhớ cậu, bạn của mình.’
▪ One of his problems is he always reacts too emotionally to things
Một trong những vấn đề của anh ta luôn phản ứng thái quá trước mọi thứ.
emotionally B2adverb(một cách) xúc động
_She spoke emotionally about herexperiences as a war correspondent.
_Many children have become emotionallydisturbed
_as a result of the abuse they have suffered.
_an emotionallycharged(= causing strong feelings) issue
emotionalismnoun[ U ]disapproving(sự)đa cảm
showing too much emotion

children.name: passionate
children.definition: use this about people who openly show very strong feelings about something, especially love or anger:
examples: sôi nổi, đầy nhiệt huyết
▪ She was a handsome Spanish woman with a passionate nature and a warm, generous heart.
Cô ấy từng là một người phụ nữ Tây Ban Nha đẹp trai với tính cách sôi nổi và một trái tim ấm áp, hào phóng.
▪ Sometimes I wish he was more passionate, not so rational about everything.
Đôi khi tôi ước anh ấy có thể nhiệt huyết hơn, không quá nhìn mọi thứ bằng lý trí.
passionately B2[adverb]
▪ She wrapped her arms around him and kissed him passionately.
Cô vòng tay quanh anh và hôn anh say đắm.
▪ The new MP argued passionately for better housing, education, and welfare services for the poor.
Nghị sĩ mới đã tranh luận sôi nổi về các dịch vụ nhà ở, giáo dục và phúc lợi tốt hơn cho người nghèo.
passionate/ˈpæʃənɪt, ˈpæʃənət/ [adjective] involving strong feelings, especially about what is right and wrong:
đam mê, kịch liệt
▪ I remember many passionate arguments taking place around this table.
passionate about:đam mê, kịch liệt về
▪ He’s passionate about the need to protect the environment.
passionate believer/opponent/supporter etc: người ủng hộ kịch liệt/đối thủ dữ dội/người ủng hộ mạnh mẽ
▪ Thatcher has always been a passionate believer in the ideals of a free market economy.
passionately[adverb]một cách kịch liệt
▪ He was passionately against nuclear weapons.
passionateadjectivehaving very strong feelings or emotions
_a passionate speech
_a passionate kiss/embrace
_The Italians are said to be the most passionate people inEurope.
_The child's mother made a passionatepleafor help.
_Joe is passionateaboutbaseball (= he likes it very much) .

children.name: with feeling
children.definition: if you say, do, or write something with feeling, you do it in a way that shows you have strong feelings about it:

children.name: nhiều cảm xúc
examples: ▪ I want you to sing it once more, this time with feeling.
Tôi muốn bạn hát lại một lần nữa, lần này nhiều cảm xúc hơn.
▪ She writes with great feeling about the fate of the refugees, having been a refugee herself in the last year.
Vì bản thân đã là người tị nạn trong nhiều năm nên cô ấy viết về số phận những người tị nạn với nhiều cảm xúc.

children.name: impassioned
children.definition: an impassioned speech, request, argument etc is full of strong feeling and emotion:
examples: sôi nổi, mãnh liệt, gây xúc động
▪ Robins criticized the investigation during an impassioned speech outside police headquarters.
Robins đã chỉ trích cuộc điều tra trong một bài phát biểu sôi nổi bên ngoài trụ sở cảnh sát.
▪ Moore gave an impassioned defense of the government’s role in the affair.
Moore đã đưa ra một lời bào chữa đầy cảm xúc về vai trò của chính phủ trong vụ việc.
an impassioned supporter/defender/champion of something
một người ủng hộ/ người biện hộ/ nhà vô địch sôi nổi
▪ Muir was an impassioned and persuasive champion of wilderness preservation.
Muir là một nhà vô địch đầy nhiệt huyết và có khả năng thuyết phục về vấn đề bảo tồn hoang dã.
impassionedadjective
describes speech or writing that is full of strongly felt and strongly expressed emotion
_Relatives of the dead made an impassionedpleafor the bodies to be flown back to this country.

children.name: events and situations that make people have strong feelings
emotional
children.definition: an emotional event or situation makes people feel strong emotions:
examples: xúc động
▪ The council’s vote came after nearly six hours of emotional debate.
Cuộc biểu quyết của hội đồng đã được công bố sau gần sáu giờ thảo luận xúc động.
▪ Newspaper reporters were there to record the emotional reunion between the woman and her children.
Các phóng viên báo chí đã ở đó để ghi lại cuộc hội ngộ xúc động giữa những người phụ nữ và con cái.
highly emotional
đầy xúc động
▪ Most couples remember the arrival of their first baby as a highly emotional time.
Hầu hết các cặp vợ chồng đều còn nhớ hình ảnh chào đời của đứa con đầu lòng như một khoảnh khắc đầy xúc động.

children.name: moving
children.definition: a moving account, experience, or event makes people feel strong emotions of pity, sadness, or joy:
examples: cảm động, làm mủi lòng, thương tâm
▪ The book is a very moving account of life in the refugee camps of Thailand.
Cuốn sách là một sự thuật lại đầy thương tâm về cuộc sống trong các trại tị nạn Thái Lan.
▪ After the final game there was a moving tribute to one of the players, who died tragically during the season.
Sau trận đấu cuối cùng, đã có một buổi lễ thương tâm dành cho một trong những cầu thủ đã chết thảm khi diễn ra mùa giải.
▪ The scene at the end of Act III is very moving, when Rafaella finds out that her husband has betrayed her.
Cảnh cuối phim Hành động III rất xúc động khi Rafaella phát hiện chồng cô đã phản bội cô.
movingadjectiveFEELINGScảm động, gợi mối thương tâm, làm mủi lòng
causing strong feelings of sadness or sympathy
_a very moving story
_I find some of Brahms's musicdeeplymoving.

children.name: touching
children.definition: a touching event or moment makes people feel a little sad and happy at the same time, and makes them like the people involved:

children.name: làm lay động, cảm động
examples: ▪ It was a touching scene when old Mr Adams received his leaving present.
Thật là một cảnh tượng cảm động khi ông Adams nhận được quà mừng thọ.
▪ It was touching to see them together. They were obviously still in love after thirty years of marriage.
Thật xúc động khi được thấy họ ở cùng nhau. Họ rõ ràng vẫn còn yêu nhau sau ba mươi năm kết hôn.

children.name: touchingadjectivecảm động
examples: making you feel sadness, sympathy, etc.

children.name: _a touching story
examples: _The way she looked after her little sister was really touching.

children.name: emotive
examples: cảm động
emotive issue/ area/ phrase etca subject, statement, use of language etc that makes people have very strong feelings or emotions, especially of anger:
đề tài/ lời bày tỏ/ lối nói cảm động
▪ The candidates agreed to avoid emotive issues like abortion and child abuse.
Các thí sinh đã đồng ý sẽ tránh các đề tài xúc động như phá thai và lạm dụng trẻ em.
highly emotivevery emotive
đầy xúc động
▪ The documentary deliberately uses highly emotive language, talking about ‘exploitation' and ’blackmail'
Bộ phim tài liệu cẩn thận sử dụng lối nói đầy xúc động, kể về 'sự bóc lột' và 'sự tống tiền'.
emotiveadjective cảm động;xúc động;xúc cảm
causing strong feelings
_Animal experimentation is a highly emotiveissue.

children.name: poignant
children.definition: especially written a poignant event, image, remark etc makes you feel great sadness and pity:
examples: cảm động, thấm thía
▪ This is one of her most beautiful and poignant works.
Đây là một trong những tác phẩm đẹp và gây xúc động nhất của cô.
▪ In a poignant moment, Richter interrupted his speech to thank his mother and father.
Trong một phút đau lòng, Richter đã tạm dừng bài phát biểu của mình để nói lời cảm ơn bố mẹ mình.
poignantly[adverb]
một cách cảm động, thương tâm, sâu sắc
▪ His remarkable life and tragic death poignantly express the hopes and disappointments of a whole generation.
Cuộc đời phi thường và cái chết bi thảm của ông đã thể hiện sâu sắc những hy vọng và sự thất vọng của một thế hệ.
poignantadjective
causing or having a very sharp feeling of sadness
_The photograph awakens poignant memories of happier days.
_Itis especially poignantthathe died on the day before the wedding.
poignantlyadverb
poignancynoun[ U ]
The poem hasahaunting poignancy.

children.name: profound
children.definition: adjectiveEXTREMEsâu sắc

children.name: felt or experienced very strongly or in an extreme way
examples: _His mother's death when he was aged six had a very profoundeffecton him.
_The invention of the contraceptive pill brought about profound changes in the lives of women.
_Those two lines of poetry express perfectly the profound sadness of loss.
_My grandfather has a profound mistrust of anything new or foreign.
_There was a note of profound irritation in his voice.

children.name: profoundlyadverbdeeply or extremely
examples: _Society has changed so profoundly over the last fifty years.
_We are all profoundly grateful for your help and encouragement.

children.name: deep
children.definition: a deep feeling is one that you feel very strongly, especially a feeling of love, disappointment, or sympathy:
examples: sâu sắc
▪ I have always had a deep affection for your family.
▪ The news came as a deep disappointment to us all.
▪ Please accept our deepest sympathies. used when someone has died
deeply B2[adverb]một cách sâu sắc
▪ He was deeply offended by their remarks.
deepadjectiveSTRONGLY FELTvery strongly felt or experienced and usually lasting a long time
_Their son has been a deep disappointment to them.
_We're in deep trouble.
_She fell into a lovely deep sleep.

children.name: strong
children.definition: cứng, mạnh
examples: ▪ The subject of abortion always arouses strong emotions.
▪ Stapleton has very strong views on capital punishment.
▪ She had a strong urge to sell everything she owned and travel abroad.
▪ The new police have received strong support from local residents.
strongly[adverb]một cách mạnh mẽ
▪ I don’t let people smoke in my house -- it’s something I feel very strongly about. s
strength /streŋθ, strenθ/ [uncountable noun]sức nặng, sức mạnh
▪ The President could not ignore the strength of public opinion.

children.name: intense
children.definition: a feeling that isintenseis extremely strong:
examples: intensely[adverb]một cách mạnh mẽ, cực kì
▪ From the moment I first met him I disliked him intensely.

children.name: cực mạnh
examples: ▪ It would give me intense pleasure to beat him at tennis.
▪ As we waited for the winner to be announced, the excitement was intense.
▪ Every car was stopped and searched, which caused intense annoyance to the drivers.

children.name: powerful
examples: ▪ Jealousy is a very powerful emotion.

children.name: ▪ Her desire to hit him was so powerful that she had to force herself to leave the room at once
fervent
children.definition: very strong and sincere:
examples: fervently[adverb]một cách rất nhiệt tâm
▪ He will be remembered as a politician who fervently argued for what he believed in.

children.name: nhiệt tâm
examples: ▪ Despite her troubled life she has always had a fervent belief in God.

children.name: fervent admirer/supporter/believer etc: người tin tưởng / ủng hộ / ngưỡng mộ nhiệt tâm
examples: ▪ Most of the people here are fervent supporters of self-determination.

children.name: ardent
children.definition: very strong and sincere: hăng hái
examples: ▪ He was a man of strong beliefs and had always given ardent support to the Reform cause.
▪ Even his most ardent supporters disagreed with this move.
ardently[adverb]một cáchhăng hái
▪ She ardently believed that women should have the same rights as men and was determined to fight for this.
ardentadjective[ before noun ]
showing strong feelings
_an ardentsupporterofManchesterUnited
_an ardent feminist
ardentlyadverb

children.name: burning
children.definition: adjectiveSTRONGA burningdesire, need, etc., is one that is very strong

children.name: _a burning ambition
examples: _He spoke of his burning desire to play forEngland.

children.name: to have a strong emotional feeling
be burning with
examples: có cảm giác rừng rực, bừng bực
be burning with curiosity/desire/anger etc
vô cùng tò mò/ ham muốn/ tức giận
to have an emotion that is so strong that it is very difficult to control:
▪ Martha was burning with curiosity but realized that now wasn’t the time to ask questions.
Martha nóng lòng vì tò mò nhưng nhận ra bây giờ không phải là lúc đặt câu hỏi.

children.name: be overcome with/by
children.definition: to feel an emotion such as sadness or disappointment sostronglythat you are unable to remain calm or think clearly:

children.name: quá ( giận giữ, đau buồn, thương tiếc...)
examples: ▪ When Diana met the starving children she was overcome with pity and outrage.
Khi Diana gặp những đứa trẻ đói khát, cô cảm thấy thương hại và giận dữ.
▪ Suddenly, I was overcome by a feeling of panic.
Đột nhiên, tôi có cảm giác hoảng sợ.
▪ Receiving the prize in honour of her dead father, she was overcome with emotion.
Cô xúc động khi nhận giải thưởng vinh danh người cha đã mất.

children.name: experience
children.definition: to feel a strong emotion such as joy, pride, or sorrow:

children.name: trải qua, bị
examples: ▪ I experienced a great sense of loss when my father died.
Tôi đã trải qua một cảm giác mất mát to lớn khi cha tôi qua đời.
▪ When she was younger, my mother experienced a depression so severe she had to be hospitalized.
Khi còn nhỏ, mẹ tôi bị trầm cảm nặng đến mức phải nhập viện.

children.name: give way to
children.definition: to let a strong emotion show or affect you, especially after you have been trying not to feel it or show it:

children.name: chiều theo, khuất khục trước (1 cảm xúc mạnh)
examples: ▪ Giving way to her grief, Anna burst into tears.
Chìm trong nỗi tuyệt vọng vô cùng, Anna bật khóc.
▪ He was ashamed to have given way to such feelings of self-pity.
Anh ta xấu hổ vì đã bản thân cảm thấy thương hại.

children.name: be beside yourself
children.definition: be besideyourself

children.name: If you are beside yourself with a particular feeling or emotion, it is so strong that it makesyou almost out of control
examples: _He was beside himself with grief when she died.

children.name: grip
children.definition: verb-pp-EMOTIONnắm chặt, siết chặt

children.name: burst
children.definition: verbburst,burst: háo hức

children.name: explosive
children.definition: adjectiveEMOTIONdescribes a situation or emotion in which strong feelings are loudly or violently expressed
examples: _Thesituationin the poorer parts of some ofAmerica's major cities has become very explosive.
_Capital punishment is an explosiveissue.
_She has an explosivetemper.

children.name: wave
children.definition: nounSTRONG FEELING cơn

children.name: A wave of an emotion or feeling is a sudden strong feeling which gets stronger as it spreads
examples: _A waveofpanic swept through the crowd and people started running.
